children.subject: Certainly, if you're working in ADEPT lab or another lab in BAR, 152 will be very helpful (as will 250 and 241B).

Not totally clear to me what you liked about 151, but if the computer architecture concepts were interesting to you, I'd recommend taking CS 152. CS 250 might be nice to take as well if you're interested in using Chisel to do hardware design. If you like digital circuits and want to explore more ASIC lab type content, EE 241B is a good option as well. If you had indicated any interest in analog design, I would have recommended EE 140, but not enjoying 105 might indicate that 140 might not be a great fit.

history.content:
<md>I'm heading into my senior year, and figured I really enjoy digital design. I took 151 last semester, with the FPGA lab and I'm currently doing the ASIC labs on my own for research. 
Kinda lost on what courses I can take next? I was in 105 last semester, but I late dropped it due to COVID circumstances and high workload with 151 and I'm not sure if I enjoyed the course content enough to enroll again, unless it's really crucial. Any recommendations on what courses I can use to brush up and continue 151 concepts (also to get ready for full time interviews)?</md>
history.subject: After 151?
